item_prototype.name: Diskstats - {#DISK_NAME} ({#DISK_MAJOR}:{#DISK_MINOR}) - number of bytes read per second
Diskstats - {#DISK_NAME} ({#DISK_MAJOR}:{#DISK_MINOR}) - number of bytes written per second
Diskstats - {#DISK_NAME} ({#DISK_MAJOR}:{#DISK_MINOR}) - number of I/Os currently in progress
item_prototype.description: The only field that should go to zero. Incremented as requests are given to appropriate struct request_queue and decremented as they finish.

item_prototype.name: Diskstats - {#DISK_NAME} ({#DISK_MAJOR}:{#DISK_MINOR}) - number of milliseconds spent doing I/Os
item_prototype.description: This field increases so long as field 9 is nonzero.

item_prototype.name: Diskstats - {#DISK_NAME} ({#DISK_MAJOR}:{#DISK_MINOR}) - number of milliseconds spent reading
item_prototype.description: This is the total number of milliseconds spent by all reads (as measured from __make_request() to end_that_request_last()).

item_prototype.name: Diskstats - {#DISK_NAME} ({#DISK_MAJOR}:{#DISK_MINOR}) - number of milliseconds spent writing
item_prototype.description: This is the total number of milliseconds spent by all writes (as measured from __make_request() to end_that_request_last()).

item_prototype.name: Diskstats - {#DISK_NAME} ({#DISK_MAJOR}:{#DISK_MINOR}) - number of reads completed
item_prototype.description: This is the total number of reads completed successfully.

item_prototype.name: Diskstats - {#DISK_NAME} ({#DISK_MAJOR}:{#DISK_MINOR}) - number of reads completed per second
Diskstats - {#DISK_NAME} ({#DISK_MAJOR}:{#DISK_MINOR}) - number of reads completed simple change
Diskstats - {#DISK_NAME} ({#DISK_MAJOR}:{#DISK_MINOR}) - number of reads merged
item_prototype.description: Reads and writes which are adjacent to each other may be merged for efficiency. Thus two 4K reads may become one 8K read before it is ultimately handed to the disk, and so it will be counted (and queued) as only one I/O. This field lets you know how often this was done.

item_prototype.name: Diskstats - {#DISK_NAME} ({#DISK_MAJOR}:{#DISK_MINOR}) - number of reads merged per second
Diskstats - {#DISK_NAME} ({#DISK_MAJOR}:{#DISK_MINOR}) - number of sectors read
item_prototype.description: This is the total number of sectors read successfully.

item_prototype.name: Diskstats - {#DISK_NAME} ({#DISK_MAJOR}:{#DISK_MINOR}) - number of sectors written
item_prototype.description: This is the total number of sectors written successfully.

item_prototype.name: Diskstats - {#DISK_NAME} ({#DISK_MAJOR}:{#DISK_MINOR}) - number of writes completed
item_prototype.description: This is the total number of writes completed successfully.

item_prototype.name: Diskstats - {#DISK_NAME} ({#DISK_MAJOR}:{#DISK_MINOR}) - number of writes completed per second
Diskstats - {#DISK_NAME} ({#DISK_MAJOR}:{#DISK_MINOR}) - number of writes completed simple change
Diskstats - {#DISK_NAME} ({#DISK_MAJOR}:{#DISK_MINOR}) - number of writes merged
item_prototype.description: Reads and writes which are adjacent to each other may be merged for efficiency. Thus two 4K reads may become one 8K read before it is ultimately handed to the disk, and so it will be counted (and queued) as only one I/O. This field lets you know how often this was done.

item_prototype.name: Diskstats - {#DISK_NAME} ({#DISK_MAJOR}:{#DISK_MINOR}) - number of writes merged per second
Diskstats - {#DISK_NAME} ({#DISK_MAJOR}:{#DISK_MINOR}) - sum of reads and writes completed simple change
Diskstats - {#DISK_NAME} ({#DISK_MAJOR}:{#DISK_MINOR}) - weighted number of milliseconds spent doing I/Os
item_prototype.description: This field is incremented at each I/O start, I/O completion, I/O merge, or read of these stats by the number of I/Os in progress (field 9) times the number of milliseconds spent doing I/O since the last update of this field. This can provide an easy measure of both I/O completion time and the backlog that may be accumulating.
